# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

# Answer

function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10) :: String
    # Initialize an empty string to store the wrapped string
    wrapped_string = ""
    
    # Split the input string into words using whitespace as a delimiter
    words = split(s, "")
    
    # Iterate over the words and add each word to the wrapped string if it fits within the text width
    for word in words
        # Get the current word's length
        word_length = length(word)
        
        # Check if the word's length is less than or equal to the text width
        if word_length <= text_width
            # Add a space and the word to the wrapped string
            wrapped_string *= " " * word * " "
        else
            # If the word exceeds the text width, add a newline character and the word to the wrapped string
            wrapped_string *= "\n" * word * "\n"
        end if
    end for
    
    # Return the wrapped string
    return wrapped_string
end function
